channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Refuse bin left by bin men in venners closre, 11th November
item.description:
Bin right outside number 4 venners close, this is a green bin left by the bin men. All residents have stated it isnt theres and no one is missing a bin. Please can this be collected as soon as possible or people will dump their rubbish and it will be a bigger issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Venners Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large laughing gas canister needs appropriate disposal., 11th November
item.description:
I found a large laughing gas canister in the road so have placed it by the green box as detailed above in Aycliffe Close for appropriate disposal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aycliffe Close, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuse Collectors Left Bags Behind in the Gutter, 11th November
item.description:
The recycle staff move the green bags off the properties into the kerb. However, this can and does lead to "non recycle" items being dumped into that garbage pile before they come to collect. Today they left piles of green bags uncollected in the kerb.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Winston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no.30-32, 11th November
item.description:
There are two young trees outside West Hampstead Women's Centre at 26-30 Cotleigh Road. One tree is really leaning and is wobbly down to the roots moving - it needs reattaching to the two stakes as the webbing was cut when the tree grew - it may fall onto a car... The other is upright but missing a stake and foxes are digging holes around it's roots. Otherwise the trees have been doing really well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26-30, Cotleigh Road, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic light is pointing the wrong way, 11th November
item.description:
Please see the traffic in the red box on the right of the picture. This is located directly outside a shop called 'Post Mark' in the centre of Greenwich, at the junction of Nelson Road and Greenwich High Road. The traffic light should be pointing directly towards the camera, just like the one on the left of the picture is. But, instead it's pointing to the left. So the traffic signal is not visible at all to the drivers that need to see it, but it IS visible to the drivers approaching from the left, to who it will give the wrong signal. I don't know how long it's been like this, this is the first time in a week I've come this way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Nelson Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Leaf clearance, 11th November
item.description:
Reported this issue already. Although they came out they didn’t actually clear the leaves just sat in their truck so the piles of leaves on High beeches & The Grove still remain untouched along the pathways & grass verges. Please can someone come back to clear. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Grove, North Cray, London

item.title: Overflowiny bin with dog poo!, 11th November
item.description:
Already reported this a few days ago. It's gotten even worse. Bin is so full up and there is so many bags of dog poo there it's so disgusting and it's right outside a school. Get this sorted please

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Halstow Road, Greenwich

item.title: Tree still needs cutting branches chunky branches have fallen into my side garden where children play, 11th November
item.description:
This is ridiculous I will keep going on and on until this is cut How is this meant to be crowning and root lifting tree and cutting all over hanging branches on my side due to it being my child’s play area if any lands on my child I will be taking you and clarion court for this The work men who cut this today and think it’s acceptable were extremely rude and didn’t even get up the tree to trim

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keedonwood Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
